New Records: Travis Head scored 62 from 48 balls to help Australia get off to a flyer
Key Match Events: Australia beat South Africa by three wickets
David Miller hit a 115-ball century for South Africa
Travis Head took two wickets in two balls to stall South Africa's counter-attack
Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins got Australia over the line
Pre-Game Insights: Australia captain Pat Cummins said they were expecting the pitch to spin quite a bit, but were not expecting to Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc to bowl so much so early
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said they showed resilience and character, but were undone by Australia's ruthlessness and ability to exploit every bit of advantage
Australia captain Pat Cummins said they were proud of their team's effort and believed they had a good chance of beating India in the final
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a tense and twitchy affair, with Australia needing 2 runs to win in the 48th over
David Miller's 115-ball century was a highlight of the South African innings
The match was played on a spinning wicket, which made it difficult for the batsmen to score runs
